properties.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued July 4 at 10:06AM CDT until July 4 at 2:00PM CDT by NWS Austin/San Antonio TX
properties.description:
FFWEWX

The National Weather Service in Austin/San Antonio has issued a

* Flash Flood Warning for...
Northeastern Bandera County in south central Texas...
Southeastern Kerr County in south central Texas...

* Until 200 PM CDT.

* At 1006 AM CDT, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated
thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. Between
2 and 5 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts of
1 to 3 inches are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is
ongoing or expected to begin shortly.

HAZARD...Life threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms
producing flash flooding.

SOURCE...Radar and automated gauges.

IMPACT...Life threatening flash flooding of creeks and streams,
urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses.

* Some locations that will experience flash flooding include...
Kerrville, Comfort, Center Point, Camp Verde, Kerrville-Schreiner
Park and Cypress Creek.

A Flash Flood Emergency remains in effect for areas along the
Guadalupe River.
properties.instruction:
Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood
deaths occur in vehicles.

Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.

Stay away or be swept away. River banks and culverts can become
unstable and unsafe.
